definition: to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: Well-dressed women accessorize according to the occasion.
sentences.chinese: 衣着入时的女士根据不同场合选戴不同饰物。

sentences.english: He likes his wife to dress well.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢自己的妻子穿着入时。

sentences.english: She's always conspicuous because of her fashionable clothes.
sentences.chinese: 她总是穿着入时，引人注目。

sentences.english: Mary wore handsome go - go boots to the discotheque last night.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽穿著一双入时的马靴参加昨晚的舞会。

sentences.english: She is always dressed in style.
Automatically unlock this keyring when I log in.
sentences.chinese: 当我登入时自动解锁此密钥环。

sentences.english: Changing this value will effect the next session login.
sentences.chinese: 改变这些数值后会在下次登入时生效。

sentences.english: At that moment a well-dressed gentlemen emerged from the station exit.
sentences.chinese: 有一个穿着入时的绅士那时出现在站台出口。

sentences.english: The Deliver on Check-in strategy has the advantage of instant gratification.
sentences.chinese: “签入时交付”策略的优势在于马上产生的满足感。

sentences.english: Many old houses have been updated with modern facilities.
sentences.chinese: 许多老房子都添设了现代设备而变成很入时的了。

definition: to manage to sell/to dispose of sth (by selling)/to get property off one's hands/to find excuses (to get off a charge)/to extricate sb (from trouble)/to vindicate/to become prettier (of child)
to have bright eyes and white teeth
